content.question: The plates of a parallel-plate capacitor are connected to a battery, resulting in a potential difference <math alttext="delta V sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Î”</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> between the plates and a charge of magnitude <math alttext="Q sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> on each plate. The capacitor is then disconnected from the battery and isolated. While the capacitor is disconnected, the two plates are moved closer together, after which the capacitor is reconnected to the same battery. The plates now have a charge of magnitude <math alttext="Q sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="Q sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> to <math alttext="Q sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="Q sub i is greater than Q sub f, which equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Q sub i is greater than Q sub f, which is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Q sub f is greater than Q sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="Q sub f equals Q sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="Q sub f is greater than Q sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
